contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Other people2|José Herrera (disambiguation){{!}}José Herrera}} {{Infobox MLB player | name = José Herrera | position = [[Outfielder]] | image = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1942|4|8}} | birth_place = [[Anzoátegui State|San Lorenzo, Anzoátegui State]], [[Venezuela]] | bats = Right | throws = Right | debutdate = June 3 | debutyear = {{By|1967}} | debutteam = [[Houston Astros]] | finaldate = April 6 | finalyear = {{By|1970}} | finalteam = [[Montreal Expos]] | stat1label = [[Batting average]] | stat1value = .264 | stat2label = [[Home run]]s | stat2value = 2 | stat3label = [[Run batted in|Runs batted in]] | stat3value = 20 | teams = <nowiki></nowiki> *[[Houston Astros]] ({{By|1967}}-{{By|1968}}) *[[Montreal Expos]] ({{By|1969}}-{{By|1970}}) | highlights = }} {{spanish name|Herrera|Ontiveros}} '''José Concepción Herrera Ontiveros''' [er-REH-rah] (born April 8, 1942 in [[Anzoátegui State|San Lorenzo, Anzoátegui State]], [[Venezuela]]) is a former [[outfielder]] in [[Major League Baseball]] who played for the [[Houston Astros]] (1967–1968) and [[Montreal Expos]] (1969–1970). He batted and threw [[right-handed]]. Herrera was signed by the Houston Colt .45s as an amateur [[free agent]] and made his debut with the team after it became the Astros. Regarded as an emotional leader in the dugout, Herrera was a classic backup outfielder and got every chance he had in the field and as a [[pinch hitter]] as well. In a four-season career, Herrera posted a .264 [[batting average]] with two [[home run]]s, 20 [[Run batted in|RBI]], 16 [[Run (baseball)|runs]], 522 [[Hit (baseball)|hits]], and 10 [[Double (baseball)|doubles]] in 80 [[games played]]. ==External links== {{Baseballstats | br=h/herrejo01 | fangraphs=1005721 | cube=Jose-Herrera-1}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Herrera, Jose | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Venezuelan baseball player | DATE OF BIRTH =April 8, 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Anzoátegui State|San Lorenzo, Anzoátegui State]], [[Venezuela]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Herrera, Jose}} [[Category:Major League Baseball outfielders]] [[Category:Houston Astros players]] [[Category:Montreal Expos players]] [[Category:Winnipeg Whips players]] [[Category:Buffalo Bisons (minor league) players]] [[Category:Amarillo Sonics players]] [[Category:Portland Beavers players]] [[Category:Jacksonville Suns players]] [[Category:Durham Bulls players]] [[Category:Vancouver Mounties players]] [[Category:Oklahoma City 89ers players]] [[Category:Toledo Mud Hens players]] [[Category:Evansville Triplets players]] [[Category:Statesville Colts players]] [[Category:Major League Baseball players from Venezuela]] [[Category:People from Anzoátegui]] [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Venezuela-baseball-outfielder-stub}}
